item.title: Today. Fences and police remain at Four Winds after forcibly...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Today. Fences and police remain at Four Winds after forcibly removing unhoused indigenous relatives last week.
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: SWEEPS week of 9/7-9/9/21 SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday-...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS week of 9/7-9/9/21
SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday- Thursday at Park Avenue West to the Northeast, Welton Street to the Southeast, and Broadway to the West.
The SWEEPS will begin each day at 5 a.m.
Please bring the following things to assist residents:

...

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/Cocoa
-Water
Please come and support our unhoused community members as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Your advocacy is much appreciated!
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housingâ€¦

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: SWEEPS update 8/31-9/2/21 SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday 8/31...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS update 8/31-9/2/21
SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday 8/31 outside of Four Winds American Indian Council, located at 5th and Bannock. There was already a crowd of community members when the fencing arrived at 4am. There was a conflict between the community and the police and 2 community members were arrested. As the sun began to come up, two prayer songs were sung and the energy smoothed out. DHOL advocates were able to enter the fenced area and assist several residents... with mobility concerns. All of the residents were offered 14 day motel vouchers, which most of them accepted. DHOL coordinated rides for all of the residents going to motels and gave bus passes to those needing to get to doctor's appointments. Approximately 8 indigenous people were traumatically and forcibly removed from their homelands, again. The fence remains encumbering the public right of way (the notice has expired) while a DPD squad car guards it 24/7. Another nonsolution waste of taxpayer dollars.
SWEEPS continued on Wednesday 9/1 at 7th and Grant. Another 8 people were traumatically displaced. No one was offered motel vouchers at this camp.
SWEEPS for the week concluded on Thursday at 4th and Sherman and 6th and Sherman. Speer Blvd is in between the two camps making it difficult to cover both areas. Approximately 12 people were traumatically displaced. No one at this camp was offered motel vouchers.
SWEEPING people does not work. Homelesness is only solved by HOUSING. Until we have the housing for people to move into, we must stop this nonsensical and expensive whack-a-mole non solution. We march onward towards Rights, Dignity, Housing....

item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: Prepare for the arrival of the newly homeless in the next 90...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Prepare for the arrival of the newly homeless in the next 90 days. It is sad that much of this could have been prevented if we could have just distributed the federal money intended to keep them from going homeless in the first place. You think the streets are crowded now? Give it a few weeks. We have seen nothing yet. You will think we are in a 3rd world country and pundits will talk about how great the economy is. Believe your eyes they are lying to you about the "economy". "They" are stealing the resources meant for us all and hording it. They will have some sort of complicated excuse, but believe your eyes. Our economy such for most people and when help is sent, it does not get where it is needed.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2wKVRC2jOOw

youtube.com

CNN 9.3.21
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: "Treasury Department shows Denver has distributed just 2.7%...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

"Treasury Department shows Denver has distributed just 2.7% of the $21.9 million in Emergency Rental Assistance Program (ERAP) funds it has received from the federal government."
---
So how many of the of the coming first time homeless could have been prevented if Denver would have just distributed the
funds it had available to those in need. Will they keep the federal money even if they don't distribute it?

...

https://www.denvervoice.org/â€¦/treasury-data-shows-denver-haâ€¦

See MoreBy Robert Davis

denvervoice.org

Treasury data shows Denver has spent only 2.7% of ERAP Funds as moratorium is lifted â€” The Denver VOICE

By Robert DavisBy Robert Davis

item.title: Denver: the frontline is everywhere, except in your own...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Denver: the frontline is everywhere, except in your own backyard, in your own community, with your own people on the line. You want to talk about land back, but not support unsheltered relatives. You want to talk about MMIW, but not support unsheltered relatives. In Colorado, the most recorded MMIW are unsheltered Native women. So however you may feel about our unhoused relatives, they are still our relatives, and they are still being attacked and forcibly removed in our homeland.
Come to a rally at the camp tonight at 7:30pm
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

Like it was written by someone else and handed to them to distribute.

Justices say federal agency lacks power to halt evictions in face of coronavirus pandemic.

Supreme Court strikes down CDC eviction moratorium despite deltaâ€™s rise

Justices say federal agency lacks power to halt evictions in face of coronavirus pandemic.Justices say federal agency lacks power to halt evictions in face of coronavirus pandemic.

item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Denver: the frontline is everywhere, except in your own backyard, in your own community, with your own people on the line. You want to talk about land back, but not support unsheltered relatives. You want to talk about MMIW, but not support unsheltered relatives. In Colorado, the most recorded MMIW are unsheltered Native women. So however you may feel about our unhoused relatives, they are still our relatives, and they are still being attacked and forcibly removed in our homeland.
Reposted from Sky Roosevelt-Morris

item.title: Eviction moratorium has ended and now unemployment benefits...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Eviction moratorium has ended and now unemployment benefits ended. Look for homelessness to double quickly.
And they tell us the economy is "booming" ... for who.

https://www.denverpost.com/â€¦/coloradans-losing-unemploymenâ€¦/

On the eve of federal unemployment benefits ending for as many as 116,000 Coloradans worries for people collecting those payments abound.

denverpost.com

Thousands of Coloradans are losing their unemployment benefits. Whatâ€™s next for them?

On the eve of federal unemployment benefits ending for as many as 116,000 Coloradans worries for people collecting those payments abound.On the eve of federal unemployment benefits ending for as many as 116,000 Coloradans worries for people collecting those payments abound.

item.title: Hey the eviction moratorium was ended. Evictions will now go...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

Hey the eviction moratorium was ended.
Evictions will now go crazy. Look for tents to increase rapidly.

https://www.nytimes.com/â€¦/â€¦/us/eviction-moratorium-ends.html

The ruling followed political and legal maneuvering by the administration to retain protections for tenants. It puts hundreds of thousands at risk of being put out of their homes.

nytimes.com

Supreme Court Ends Bidenâ€™s Eviction Moratorium

The ruling followed political and legal maneuvering by the administration to retain protections for tenants. It puts hundreds of thousands at risk of being put out of their homes.The ruling followed political and legal maneuvering by the administration to retain protections for tenants. It puts hundreds of thousands at risk of being put out of their homes.

item.title: So this happened last week. A nationally know award winning...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

So this happened last week. A nationally know award winning documentary film crew apparently looked threatening to DPD who decided to try and scare them off. They had not done anything to give DPD a reason to approach. even thought they did not do any thing with wat DPD was doing at the time. They always get "squitchy" when they think you are watching in a way that will hold them accountable to their own rules.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cA15i8aNyMs

youtube.com

Award winning film crew threatened with arrest

item.title: SWEEPS week of 8/30-9/3/21 SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday 8/31...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS week of 8/30-9/3/21
SWEEPS next week are on Tuesday 8/31 at 6th Avenue to the North, Acoma Street to the East, W. 4th Avenue to the South, and Cherokee Street to the West; on Wednesday 9/1 at E. 10th Avenue to the North, Logan Street to the East, E. 6th Avenue to the South, and Lincoln Street to the West ; on Thursday 9/2 at E. 8th Avenue to the North, Grant Street to the East, E. 3rd Avenue to the South, and Lincoln Street to the West.
The SWEEPS will begin each day ...at 5 a.m.
Please bring the following things to assist residents:

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/Cocoa
-Water
Please come and support our unhoused community members as they demand real housing or places where they are allowed to survive.
Your advocacy is much appreciated!
Toward Rights, Dignity and Housingâ€¦

Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291
dhol logo.png

See More
item.author: Denver Homeless Out Loud

item.title: SWEEPS update 8/23-8/27/21 SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday...
item.content:encoded:
Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEPS update 8/23-8/27/21
SWEEPS this week began on Tuesday 8/24 at 26th and Larimer. Approximately 10 people were traumatically displaced. Most of this camp moved to 22nd and Wazee. Within 2 hours of arriving there, Officer Udland arrived to tell them to move. The Officer left shortly after DHOL arrived but returned later to give 48 hours camping ban notices.
SWEEPS continued on Wednesday 8/25 at 17th and Washington. EHS workers requested that DPD engage with the Universal ...Basic Income film crew that was following DHOL while they were filming from at least 15 feet away clearly not interfering with their actions and remaining behind the fence. Giving a trash man the full power of police enforcement at his whim. Approximately 10 people were traumatically displaced.
SWEEPS for the week concluded on Thursday 8/26 at 11th. DPD, DHOL, and Mutual Aid worker worked collaboratively to troubleshoot getting a woman into housing. (She was accepted at a local shelter Friday 8/27 through this collaboration). Approximately 12 people were traumatically displaced.
While that SWEEP was wrapping up, DHOL received a call from residents at 22nd and Wazee. Officer Lombardi was there giving written warnings. DHOL arrived and had a conversation with Officer Lombardi. The residents at the camp were all couples. Since there are no shelters for couples DHOL and Officer Lombardi requested motel rooms. Officer Lombardi was able to get each couple a motel room for the weekend. The city provided storage and DHOL provided bus tickets to and from storage for the residents. a mutual aid volunteer transported the couples to the motel.
It is a travesty that one policy greatly prohibits the collaboration that organically develops when many people are part of an issue in which there are viable solutions. The Mayor is only one man. According our city charter, he cannot carry out any policy without our city council's approval. City Council has the ability to decide ordinances, their enforcement and their penalty. There are many ways to engage departments, businesses, organizations, advocates, and community in realtime solutions. Demand it. WE ARE THE PEOPLE.
SWEEPING people does not work. Homelesness is only solved by HOUSING. Until we have the housing for people to move into, we must stop this nonsensical and expensive whack-a-mole non solution. We march onward towards Rights, Dignity, Housing....
